Explanations about Options.-l(C): The issue with "ls -1 | wc -l 2009*" is that you execute "wc -l" directly on the files matching "2009*", counting the number of lines in each. Also, "grep" can do the counting so if "grep" is in the mix, just add the "-c" option to grep instead of piping the output to "wc -l", so "ls | grep -cE "\.pdf$"" or if you want to avoid counting directories named "<something.pdf>": "ls -l | grep -cE "^-.*\.pdf$"".
